disengagements_reason.reason: The test vehicle's software recommended an incorrect lane change to the software operator. Conditions: Non-inclement weather, dry roads, no other factors involved

During a merge, the test vehicle failed to keep an appropriate distance between a merging car or the merging car failed to yield to us. Conditions: Non-inclement weather, dry roads, no other factors involved

During an exit/merge the test vehicle was going the "correct" speed as posted by road signs, but was going too slow or too fast given the traffic and road conditions. Conditions: Non-inclement weather, dry roads, no other factors involved
The test vehicle's software recommended an incorrect lane to move into during an upcoming exit on the freeway. Conditions: Non-inclement weather, dry roads, no other factors involved
The test vehicle makes a lane change at an inproper speed, e.g: slow acceleration. Conditions: Non-inclement weather, dry roads, no other factors involved
This occurs when the test vehicle is making an autonomous lane change and it cuts across the lane marker into another lane. Conditions: Non-inclement weather, dry roads, no other factors involved
During a lane change, the test vehicle oscillates from left to right in the lane. Conditions: Non-inclement weather, dry roads, no other factors involved
Motion control health check caused software kickout
Sensor data mismatch caused software kickout
Incorrect prediction lead to undesirable motion plan
Hardware diagnostic caused software kickout
Incorrect prediction lead to undesirable motion plan
Incorrect map encoding lead to undesirable motion plan
Incorrect perception lead to undesirable motion plan

Incorrect prediction of vehicle caused undesirable motion plan
Incorrect perception of traffic signal lead to undesirable motion plan
Sensor/Perception discrepancy resulted in  incorrect predictions for motion planning
Undesireable motion plan violating traffic signal
Motion plan exceeded speed limit
Hardware diagnostic detected hardware health issue
Motion planning unable to produce valid trajectory
Reduced visibility of a vehicle due to occlusions resulted in an undesirable motion plan
Incorrect prediction lead to undesirable motion plan violating keep clear zone
System issue interrupted driving algorithm
Undesireable motion plan violating keep clear zone
Incorrect prediction of parked vehicle caused undesirable motion plan
Safety driver discomfort due to selected motion plan
Unexpected or reckless behavior of other road user
Planning Discrepancy: Failure to yield to other actors
Planning Discrepancy: Incorrect behavior while following a vehicle
Planning Module Failure due to software issue
Planning Discrepancy: Poor trajectory across lanes
Planning Module Failure due to mapping issue
Planning Discrepancy:  Poor lane change in contested target lane
Perception Discrepancy: Lost track of open door of parked vehicle
Planning Discrepancy: AV reacted poorly for merging vehicle
Planning Discrepancy: Incorrect behavior at traffic light
Disengagement for unwanted maneuver of the vehicle in merging situation with consequtive aggressive cut-ins in front of the vehicle in down town San Jose.
Disengagement for a perception discrepancy false possitive which impacted the vehicle to react and make unwanted maneuver

Clear weather, good surface conditions. Trajectory message timeout: Took too long to plan trajectory. Driver assumed control in less than 1 second of system alert. Clarification:The autonomous vehicle has a safety mechanism to alert the driver if the trajectory calculations are not completed within a margin of safety and this system notified the driver to be prepared to take over. The driver took over within 1 second and the autonomous feature was disengaged. The root cause was identified and rectified on the 1/14 to be retested successfully on the 15th Jan.
Clear weather, good surface conditions. Disengagement was the result of a planned test of the autonomous technology. Driver assumed control in less than 1 second.
precautionary takeover to address planning, AV attempted unsuccesful left turn
precautionary takeover to address planning, third party lane encroachment
precautionary takeover to address controls, other road user behaving poorly
precautionary takeover to address prediction, other road user behaving poorly
precautionary takeover to address planning, other road user behaving poorly
precautionary takeover to address perception, other road user behaving poorly
precautionary takeover to address planning, third party lane obstruction
precautionary takeover to address controls, AV lane encroachment
precautionary takeover to address planning, AV attempted unsuccesful lane change
precautionary takeover to address perception, AV lane encroachment
Disengage for unwanted vehicle maneuver due to perception of a parked vehicles
Disengage for a late detection of a pedestrian riding a scooter.
A collision hazard in the environment ahead was detected by the software, which triggered an Estop
The Test Driver saw an inanimate obstacle ahead and preemtively triggered a soft stop
The Test Driver chose to stop preemtively to let another vehicle clear from the AV's path
The Test Driver chose to stop preemtively to let a pedestrian clear from the AV's path
The software detected an inanimate object in the AV's path and triggered an Estop
The Test Driver chose to stop preemtively to let a cyclist clear from the AV's path
The software detected another vehicle in the AV's path and triggered an Estop
The software detected a pedestrian in the AV's path and triggered an Estop
The weather caused a lidar impact that the software interpereted as an obstacle and caused an Estop
Perception discrepancy; On city road in moderate traffic in light rain during dusk
Motion/Behaviour planning discrepancy; On city road in heavy traffic with cloudy sky during day
Perception discrepancy; On city road in heavy traffic with cloudy sky during night
Hardware discrepancy or system fault; On city road in moderate traffic with clear sky during night
Motion/Behaviour planning discrepancy; On city road in heavy traffic with cloudy sky during dusk
Perception discrepancy; On city road in moderate traffic with cloudy sky during night
Perception discrepancy; On city road in moderate traffic with clear sky during dusk
Reckless Agent/Road User; Prediction discrepancy; On city road in heavy traffic with cloudy sky during dusk
Motion/Behaviour planning discrepancy; On city road in heavy traffic with clear sky during day
Motion/Behaviour planning discrepancy; On city road in moderate traffic with clear sky during night
Motion/Behaviour planning discrepancy; On city road in moderate traffic with cloudy sky during dusk
Disengage for a perception discrepancy for which a component of the vehicle’s perception system failed to detect an object correctly
Disengage for unwanted maneuver of the vehicle caused by a planning discrepancy while generating an appropriate trajectory
Disengage for unwanted maneuver of the vehicle caused by map discrepancy
Disengage for unwanted maneuver of the vehicle caused by a control discrepancy in delivering the planned trajectory to the vehicle’s controls system
Disengage for a software fault due to a potential performance issue with a software component of the self-driving system (including third party software components)

company_name: Mercedes Benz Research & Development North America, Inc

disengagements_reason.reason: The system disengaged because of an error with the maps component. The systemasked the operator to take control of the vehicle.
The planner was not able to generate a valid trajectory. The system asked theoperator to take control of the vehicle.
The system disengaged because of an error with the maps component. The system asked the operator to take control of the vehicle.
The planner was not able to generate a valid trajectory. The system asked the operator to take control of the vehicle.
The operator disengaged the system manually to remain in the operational design domain. This was accomplished by pressing the brake pedal to reduce the velocity of the vehicle.
The operator disengaged the system manually to remain in the operational design domain. The driver performed a steering manouver to correct the trajectory of the vehicle.

A general error caused the system to stop the engaged status. Vehicle not in an active construction zone. No emergency vehicles or collisions present in the vicinity. Weather and/or road conditions dry in the area.
An issue with motion control system caused the system to disengage. The system asked the operator to take control of the vehicle.

The planner was not able to generate a valid trajectory. The system asked the operator to take control of the vehicle. The operator disengaged the system manually to remain in the operational design domain. This was accomplished by pressing the brake pedal to reduce the velocity of the vehicle.
An issue with environment model caused the system to disengage. The system asked the operator to take control of the vehicle.

The planner was not able to generate a valid trajectory. The system asked the operator to take control of the vehicle. The operator disengaged the system manually to remain in the operational design domain. The driver performed a steering manouver to correct the trajectory of the vehicle.

Driver performed steering maneuver because the vehicle didn’t drive on the expected path. Vehicle not in an active construction zone. No emergency vehicles or collisions present in the vicinity. Weather and/or road conditions dry in the area.

Driver pressed the brake pedal because the vehicle was driving faster than driver expected. Vehicle not in an active construction zone. No emergency vehicles or collisions present in the vicinity. Weather and/or road conditions dry in the area.
An issue with localization component caused the system to disengage. The system asked the operator to take control of the vehicle.
A middleware component was offline, leading to the system disengagement. The system asked the operator to take control of the vehicle.
The system disengaged because of an error with the fusion component. The system asked the operator to take control of the vehicle.
Invalid control unit operation. Vehicle not in an active construction zone. No emergency vehicles or collisions present in the vicinity. Weather and/or road conditions dry in the area.

System detects driver override due to significant one-sided road bump. Vehicle not in an active construction zone. No emergency vehicles or collisions present in the vicinity. Weather and/or road conditions dry in the area.

Quality of generated trajectory did not meet the system’s expectation. Vehicle not in an active construction zone. No emergency vehicles or collisions present in the vicinity. Weather and/or road conditions dry in the area.
An issue with pedestrian detection caused the system to disengage. The system asked the operator to take control of the vehicle.

Driver pressed the accelerator pedal because the vehicle was driving slower than driver expected. Vehicle not in an active construction zone. No emergency vehicles or collisions present in the vicinity. Weather and/or road conditions dry in the area.

When the AV was making a lane change, too much acceleration was observed despite the existence of lead vehicle on the target lane. The driver safely disengaged and resumed manual control shortly after the unexpected acceleration.
The AV controller unexpectedly stopped running and AV operation was disengaged. The driver safely took over control of the vehicle shortly after the disengagement.
The AV was Breaking incorrectly. As a result the safety driver disengaged and resumed manual control.
Comparing map files and an offset was noticed by the safety driver as a result the safety driver disengaged and resumed manual control.
Object Perception: late perception of in-road crosswalk sign
Planning Logic: following conservative yield, vehicle behind made contact. No reportable damage of property or bodily injury
Planning Logic: planner inadequately yields to lead vehicle coming to a stop
Planning Logic: incorrect behavior prediction for vehicle at roundabout results in a planned trajectory that overlaps with the vehicle
Object Perception: late perception of small box in planner's path
Object Perception: late perception of rock in planner's path
Object Perception: late perception of ripped tire in planner's path
Planning Logic: planner inadequately yields to vehicle turning into our lane
Object Perception: late perception of trash bag in planner's path
Disengage due to operator discomfort
Disengage due to perception mismatch
Disengage due to operating outside ODD (road condition, weather, traffic)
Planning, driver precautionarily intervened for a reckless neighbor vehicle cuts in our lane
Planning, driver precautionarily intervened for a reckless left vehicle makes a right turn from a go straight lane
Prediction, driver precautionarily intervened for a cyclist in bike lane before ADV enters zigzag(Single lane to two lanes split)
Planning, driver precautionarily intervened for a vehicle cuts in ADV's lane suddenly
Planning, driver precautionarily intervened for a bus drives crossing its lane boundary
Mapping, driver precautionarily intervened before vehicle runs to curb
Mapping,Driver precautionarily intervened for mis detected leading vehicle due to incorrect map information
Planning, driver precautionarily intervened for a cyclist proceeding to us in high speed
Planning, driver precautionarily intervened for insufficient yielding to a vehicle going straight
Mapping, unable to detect oncoming vehicle due to missing roadgraph
Prediction, driver precautionarily intervened for a vehicle lane change without looking
driver precautionarily intervened for a reckless cutting in vehicle
Planning, driver precautionarily intervened for reckless  behind vehicle rushing to enter zigzag(Single lane to two lanes split)
Perception, driver took over to avoid hitting a gate which is accidently closed by a community safety guard
Driver disengagement due to safety monitor notification of planning discrepancy in the determination of vehicle trajectory
Driver disengagement due to control discrepancy resulting in undesired lateral movement in the lane
Driver precautionary disengagement due to aggressive cut-in by other vehicle
Driver disengagement due to safety monitor notification of general system discrepancy
Driver disengagement due to planning discrepancy in the determination of autonomous vehicle speed
Driver disengagement due to planning discrepancy in yielding to merging vehicle
Driver disengagement due to perception discrepancy in the detection of merging vehicle
Driver disengagement due to safety monitor notification of positioning discrepancy  of autonomous vehicle
Driver disengagement due to control discrepancy to maintain minimum follow distance
Driver precautionary disengagement due to aggressive maneuver by vehicle in the adjacent lane
Driver disengagement due to safety monitor notification of planning discrepancy in the planning of lane change
Driver disengagement due to positioning discrepancy of the autonomous vehicle
Driver precautionary disengagement due to aggressive driver passing in lane merge zone
Driver precautionary disengagement due to aggressive driver passing during lane change
Driver disengagement due to planning discrepancy in the execution of mandatory lane change
Driver disengagement due to planning discrepancy in the recommendation of lane change
Driver disengagement due to perception discrepancy in the detection of vehicle in adjacent lane

AV(Autonomous Vehicle) taking a left turn on a narrow street and got close to a parked car on the street.  Safety Driver makes a preventive intervention to avoid AV getting too close to the parked car.
AV fails to make a right turn on a tight corner with parked vehicles on either side and slows down.  Safety Driver takes over.
AV drives close to a parked car with an open door, on a narrow street.  Safety drive makes a preventive intervention to avoid any close encounters.

AV takes a wide turn at a stop sign intersection, resulting in the AV stepping on the opposite lane boundary.  Driver takes over.  Cause: Error in Lidar-vehicle calibration resulted in a high cross track error in lateral controller causing the wide turn.
AV gets closer to a parked vehicle on a narrow street.  Driver takes over to avoid any unsafe situation.

Parker cars on both sides of a narrow street, with another vehicle approaching from oncoming lane.  AV yields to the onccoming vehicle and starts coming to a stop.  Driver takes over to ensure encounter is safe.

AV takes a wide turn at an intersection of a narrow street, resulting in AV getting close to parked vehicle on right.  Cause: Error in Lidar-vehicle calibration resulted in a high cross error in lateral controller causing the wide turn.
AV maneuvering around a parked car on a narrow street.  Driver takes over as AV gets closer to the parked car.

AV takes a wide turn at a stop sign intersection, resulting in the AV stepping on the opposite lane boundary. Driver makes a preventive intervention.  Error in Lidar-vehicle calibation results in a higher cross track error in lateral controller causing the wide turn.

AV takes a wide left turn on the curve of a narrow street, resulting  in AV driving close to parked vehicle on the right. Driver makes a preventive intervention to avoid any close encounters. Cause: Error in Lidar-vehicle calibation results in a higher cross track error in lateral controller causing the wide turn.

AV takes a wide left turn on the curve of a narrow street. Driver makes a preventive intervention to avoid any close encounters. Cause: Error in Lidar-vehicle calibation results in a higher cross track error in lateral controller causing the wide turn.

Narrow street with two large parked vehicles (mail van and pickup truck)  on either side. Gap on either side is less than  AV Planner's safety thresolds, resulting in planner stopping the vehicle. Driver takes over.

Narrow path in front of the AV with parked cars on both sides. Another vehicle coming in the on coming lane. AV yeilds to the on coming vehicle and starts coming to a stop. Safety driver initiates take over to make sure the encounter is safe.
Driver makes a preventive intervention, when he sees an on-coming vehicle on a narrow street with parked cars on either sides leaving narrow gap for both vehicles to pass each other.

AV making wide right turn, with on coming vehicle in opposite lane of a narrow street. Driver makes a preventive intervention to avoid any unsafe situation. Cause: Lateral controls issue causing wider than usual turn.

AV taking a left turn, close to a parked car on a narrow street, resulting in an initial nudge away from the parked vehicle. Driver makes a preventative intervention to avoid unsafe situation with parked car.

Small steering oscillation detected for a couple of seconds. The safety driver decides to take over. Cause:  Lateral controller sensitivity to quick path change commands or localization errors causing oscillation.
Safety driver decided to pull over to the side to let a faster trailing vehicle pass.

AV creeps cautiously after stopping at a stop sign intersection, watching out for other crossing vehicles. Oncoming traffic on the cross street. Safety driver initiates the take over to avoid possible honking response from other vehicle to the AV interaction at stop sign, which is  slower & conservative than a typical driver.
Safety driver decided to take over to let a faster trailing vehicle pass the AV.
Safety driver decided to take over to let a faster trailer vehicle pass the AV
AV falsely detects a pedestrian yield sign as a pedestrian, causing the AV to come to a stop. Safety driver initiates take over to maintain smooth traffic flow.

AV making wide left turn, with on coming vehicle in opposite lane of a narrow street. Driver makes a preventive intervention to avoid any unsafe situation. Cause: Lateral controls issue causing wider than usual turn.

AV at a busy 4-way stop sign intersection. The current AV version takes a cautious stop-creep action at a stop sign junction, which is slower than a typical human driver. Safety driver took over to avoid any inconvenience to other vehicles.
Driver makes a preventive intervention, when he sees an on-coming vehicle on a narrow street with parked cars on either sides leaving narrow gap for both vehicles to pass each other.

AV at a busy stop sign intersection. The current AV version takes a cautious stop-creep action at a stop sign junction, which is slower than a typical human driver. Safety driver took over to avoid any honking response from other vehicles.
Narrow street with parked vehicles  on either side. Gap on either side is less than  AV Planner's safety thresolds, resulting in planner stopping the vehicle. Driver takes over.
Narrow street with parked vehicles on either side. Gap on either side is less than AV Planner's safety thresolds, resulting in planner stopping the vehicle. Driver takes over.

AV not able to plan a path through a narrow street with parked cars on either side,  causing it to come to a stop. Driver takes over. Cause: Localization error in position causing issues in motion planning module .
AV localization becomes inconsistent, as observed on the in-vehicle monitor. AV starts moving from center of the lane towards the curb. Safety driver takes over to avoid unsafe situation.
Safety Driver takes over when AV doesn't move forward at a stop sign. Cause: New route is commanded to the AV is negotiating a stop sign, which caused a problem in the motion planner.

AV going straight with no other vehicles in front or on coming. No parked vehicles on the side, and no other fake obstacle detected, but localization becomes inconsistent and AV starts floating in the HD map. This results in AV wanting to turn in to the curb. Safety driver takes over to avoid unsafe situation.
AV stops and waits at a tight corner, as the planner fails to generate a path to maneuver the tight corner with a parked car in its way. Safety driver takes over to continue testing.
AV started to plan around parked car with little room. Safety driver decided to take over to avod any close encounter.

Lateral oscillation detected for a couple of seconds. The safety driver decided to take over. Cause:  Lateral controller sensitivity to quick path change commands or localization errors causing oscillation.

Autonomous mode initiated in a narrow path. Motion planner commands to manuever around a parked vehicle to the right. Unstability in localization heading angle cause small oscillations in controller action. Safety driver initiates a take over to avoid any possible unsafe situation.

AV at a junction where AV has the right of way to move forward. Oncoming car cutting across does not come to a complete stop. Prediction module appears to cause AV to stop. Safety driver does a preventive  intervention to continue flow of traffic.
Safety Driver makes a preventive intervention to avoid AV getting too close to a parked vehicle on a narrow street.
Parked vehicle at the corner blocking path of AV while taking a right turn. AV percepion appears to prevent vehicle from moving forward. Safety driver took over to continue the flow of traffic.
Safety Driver makes a preventive intervention to avoid AV getting  close to a pedestrian on road.
AV vehicle slowed down for an object detected in its path near a yield sign. Safety driver took over for faster moving trailing vehicles.

AV at a stop sign intersection with one other vehicle. The current AV version takes a cautious stop-creep action at a stop sign junction, which is slower than a typical human driver. Safety driver took over to avoid any inconvenience to the other vehicle
Safety driver decides to take over to let a faster trailing vehicle pass.
AV turning right. Construction warning signs on the side of the turn not detected by AV.Driver takes over to avoid AV getting close to the construction zone.
AV merging into a faster lane. Safety driver decided to take over to let faster oncoming vehicles pass the AV, before AV merging into their lane.
Av planner fails to slow down for a right turn and goes straight instead after missing the turn. Safety Driver takes over to put the vehicle back to the testing route.

AV needs to make a left turn in narrow street with parked vehicles on right side after the turn. The planner is not able to create a consistent path around parked vehicles in to the turn. It keeps swithcing between finding a path and requesting AV to come to complete stop, at edge of decision boundary, resulting in AV to start slowing down . Safety Driver takes over to maintain a smooth traffic flow.
Safety driver takes over, while AV trying to make a left turn after a stop sign, as he notices the computing load is high resulting in bad localization and controls performance.

AV has just made a right turn and there is an oncoming vehicle in the opposite lane, resulting in a narrow path  between parked car(on the right) and on coming vehicle(on the left) for the AV to follow. Safety driver initiated the take over, when he noticed the steering move to the left. Cause: Wrong Prediction of on-coming vehicle trajectory for a small time instant causing the vehicle to move in the wrong direction for that time instant.

The AV is at a stop sign and is observed to be slower than usual to start when it has right of way. Safety driver takes over to avoid cross traffic waiting long for AV to negotiate intersection. The compute seems to be glitchy at the turn making planning, controls and localization performance bad.
Safety driver initiates a take over as a faster moving trailing vehicle gets too close to  the AV.
Safety driver a takes over to let a faster trailing vehicle to pass.

AV at a busy stop sign intersection. The current AV version takes a cautious stop-creep action at a stop sign junction, which is slower than a typical human driver. Safety driver took over to avoid any inconvenience to other crossing vehicles at the intersection.
AV turning right. Construction warning signs on the side of the turn not detected by AV.Driver takes over to avoid AV getting close to the construction zone.

Box truck parked on right side of AV. Slight bend on the road of traversal created a limited view of oncoming lane to the AV. AV decides to nudge left, but gets too close to the on coming vehicle from the opposite side. Safety driver initiates a take over to make get through the narrow zone between Box truck and the on coming vehicle.

Vehicle starts to drift from its expected path on the lane, possibly due to effective loss of either localization or compute or network transport of the localization data. Driver takes over quickly to avoid any unsafe situation.
Vehicle drifing on to on coming lane, due to effective loss of one or many of either localization, compute or network transport of the localization data. Results in driver take over.
AV did not detect contruction ditch on side of the road. Safety driver took over as a precaution.
AV steering oscillates, when the autonomous mode is initated off the center of lane.  Safety driver takes over to avoid any unsafe situation.

Narrow street with parked vehicles on one side and on-coming vehicle on the other side. Gap on either side is less than AV Planner's safety thresolds, resulting in planner stopping the vehicle. Driver takes over to maneuver the AV through the narrow gap.

AV at a stop sign intersection with one other vehicle. The current AV version takes a cautious stop-creep action at a stop sign junction, which is  slower & conservative than a typical human driver. Safety driver took over to avoid any inconvenience to the other vehicle

AV decides to stop for an on-coming vehicle, even though there is enough room for both vehicles in their respective lanes. Safety driver takes over so that the AV does not come to an unexpected stop on the steet.Cause: Wrong prediction of oncoming vehicle movement.
Safety driver took over to pass a slow moving construction vehicle on side of the road.
Construction  cones on the side not detected. AV got close to the cones. Safety Driver takes over before AV gets any closer to the construction zone.

AV at a stop sign intersection with one other vehicle. The current AV version takes a cautious stop-creep action at a stop sign junction, which is  slower & conservative than a typical human driver. Safety driver took over to avoid any inconvenience to the other vehicle. No AV system fault.

AV at a stop sign intersection with one other trailing vehicle. The current AV version takes a cautious stop-creep action at a stop sign junction, which is  slower & conservative than a typical human driver. Safety driver took over to avoid any inconvenience to the other vehicle
Safety driver makes a preventive intervention, as he car infront is making a 2-point u-turn.

Perception detects a vehicle where construction vehicle is parked. Possible that the detected obstacle boundary is not accurate to the actual construction vehicle, resulting in planned path that is closer to the construction vehicle. Safety driver initiates a take over to make sure AV safely navigates the parked construction zone
Faster following vehicle. 25 mph max speed on 40 mph street
Safety driver makes a preventive intervention, with an on-coming vehicle on a narrow road

AV making wide right turn, with on coming vehicle in opposite lane of the road. Driver makes a preventive intervention to avoid any unsafe situation. Cause: Lateral controls issue causing wider than usual turn.

AV at a busy stop sign intersection. AV starts to move after the first cross vehicle turns in, however it comes to a stop when another vehicle approaches the cross stop sign. The second vehicle also turns in ahead of AV, as the AV response is slow and conservative. Safety driver intervenes once the 2nd vehicle took AV's right of way.

AV decides to stop for an on-coming vehicle, even though there is enough room for both vehicles in their respective lanes. Safety driver takes over so that the AV does not come to an unexpected stop on the steet.
AV at stop sign intersection with vehicles turning in to the AV lane of travel. Safety driver takes over once the AV misses it's right of way.
AV falsely detects a pedestrian yield sign as a pedestrian, causing the AV to come to a stop. Safety driver initiates take over to maintain smooth traffic flow.No AV system fault detected.
Safety driver makes a preventive intervention, with an on-coming vehicle on a narrow road. No AV system fault detected.
Safety driver decided to take over to let a faster trailer vehicle pass the AV for their convenience. No AV system fault detected.

AV at a 4-way stop sign intersection with other vehicles. The current AV version takes a cautious stop-creep action at a stop sign junction, which is slower than a typical human driver. Safety driver took over to avoid any inconvenience to other vehicles.

AV at a stop sign intersection with two  other trailing vehicles. The current AV version takes a cautious stop-creep action at a stop sign junction, which is  slower & conservative than a typical human driver. Safety driver took over to avoid any inconvenience to the other vehicles
Localization Issue: Failed to stop within a certain distance of stop line at traffic light
Motion & Planning Issue: Planning node crashed on urban street
Hardware Issue: Wrong GPS state
Perception Issue: Vehicle too slow to start after the stop at traffic light
Safety precaution: Heavy traffic on highway entrance
Hardware Issue: Smart camera stop working
Safety precaution: vehicle merging
Safety precaution: Heavy traffic to complete lane change
Safety precaution: Heavy traffic
Localization Issue: Wrong GPS state
Localization Issue: Vehicle drove too close to the right lane
Perception Issue: Smart camera lane detection offset too close to the left
Safety precaution: Vehicle merging
Safety precaution: Vehicle too close to the right lane
Safety precaution: DBW beeping noise
Safety precaution: Smart camera output problem from visualizer
Motion & Planning Issue: wrong trajectory at the curve from visualizer with a new module
Motion & Planning Issue: Smart camera output problem from visualizer
Motion & Planning Issue: Wrong trajectory at highway exit

The car was performing a parking maneuver, when the driver had to take control, because the side wall was within 0.4 meters from the car. This event was caused by the error in object detection by ultrasonic sensor.

The car was performing a parking maneuver, when the driver had to take control, because the back wall was within 1.5 meter from the car rear bumper. This event was caused by the error in object detection by rear ultrasonic sensor.
Safety Driver disengaged due to inappropriate braking proposal.
Safety Driver disengaged to ensure proper behavior at traffic light.
Safety Driver disengaged due to inappropriate braking, caused by perception issue.
Safety Driver disengaged due to issue with lane change maneuver.
Safety Driver disengaged due to inappropriate steering.
Safety Driver disengaged upon judging that vehicle was too close to road boundary.
Safety Driver disengaged near crosswalk due to overly conservative vehicle behavior.
Safety Driver disengaged upon judging that vehicle was too close to other road user or obstacle.
Safety Driver proactively disengaged upon recognizing that a planned maneuver or action did not conform to internal guidelines.
Safety Driver disengaged due to harsh braking.
Safety Driver disengaged to manually drive through crosswalk.
Safety Driver disengaged due to cut-in issue.
Safety Driver disengaged to re-center vehicle in lane.
Perception issue: sensor data (radar, lidar, and camera), or autonomy system's interpretation of sensor data, had a shortcoming or inaccuracy that affected driving behavior
Planning issue: the trajectory planned by the autonomy system was flawed, in that it disrupted traffic flow, resulted in unsafe maneuvering, or did not advance vehicle toward destination
Control issue: the vehicle control and actuation system could not, or did not, accurately follow the trajectory planned by the autonomy system
Car did not slow down soon enough for detected vehicle, perception saw vehicle in motion when static
Delivery truck parked in lane, would break rules to cross into oncoming lane to get around it
Car did not drive once traffic light turned green, acceleration request too low for longitudinal control
Car getting close to curb of sidewalk while driving due to oscillation in lateral control
Car stopping too close to crosswalk at intersection, map annotation incorrect
Speed not reduced during right turn, curvature in map annotation not correctly defined
Car too slow to cross stop-intersection when it was its turn to go (at 4 way stop) due controls logic
Reckless driver tailgating us at a stop
Reckless driver making 3-point turn backing into our lane
Car creeping forward during red light at intersection, confidence in red light detection was fluctuating
Understeer on right turn, control tuning needs improvement
Controls disengaged after requested a deceleration beyond limit
Car approaching stop intersection too fast, deceleration profile for longitudonal control required tuning
Car approaching stop intersection too fast,  deceleration profile for longitudonal control required tuning
Car creeping into crosswalk when stopping for intersection, incorrect map annotation for crosswalk intersection
Car too slow to make left turn at intersection, intersection deemed not clear although car had right of way
Stopped at pedestrian crossing when there was no pedestrian, yield sign misinterpreted as pedestrian
Detected green traffic light color when red, misclassification in perception
Car too slow to cross stop-intersection when it was its turn due to controls logic
Car taking too long to make a lane change, perception judged space insufficient
Car backing out into vehicle and pedestrians J-walking on opposite side of street
Stopped on right turn at red light too early before proceeding, planning needs to be modified to account for right turn visibility at intersection
Reckless driver tailgating
Detected red traffic light color when green, missclassification in perception
Right turn at traffic light too slow, due to internal system speed contraint
Vehicle on left of 3-way stop intersection not detected, sensors inputs into fusion layer did not agree with high confidence that a perpendicular facing vehicle was at the intersection
Car too slow to make left turn at intersection, due to internal system speed contraint
Car stopped too far from line at intersection, map annotation incorrect
Reckless driver behind car trying to undertake during right turn.
Car detected green traffic light color when red, missclassification in perception
Car driving too slow due to stopped truck straddling lane
Parked vehicle sticking out in road
Car stopped, then proceeded to make right turn on red however did not have sufficient view of oncoming traffic
Car was going to cross 4-way stop intersection when it was not its turn, perception insufficient
Reckless driver trying to undertake on right turn at red light
Car detected red traffic light color instead of green, missclassification in perception
Car software crashed, and system needed to be rebooted, under investigation
Vehicle in adjacent lane was too close to car
Industrial garbage bin obstructing lane
Car steering into bike lane, disagreement between actual and estimated positions
Car stopped in middle of intersection and did not proceed after pedestrian was finished crossing crosswalk
Car did not see vehicle to right during 4-way stop, perception issue
Person on scooter weaving in lane
Yellow light detected in middle of right-turn at traffic light
Car did not detect vehicle in front, perception saw vehicle in motion when static
Vehicle backing up from parking spot into lane
Car stopped on right turn on red (did not complete turn), slow down command during turn execution
Disengage for unwanted maneuver of the vehicle that was undesirable under the circumstances
Disengage for a recklessly behaving road user
Disengage for adverse weather conditions experienced during testing
Disengage for incorrect behavior prediction of other traffic participants
Disengage for a perception discrepancy for which a component of the vehicle's perception system failed to detect an object correctly
Discrepancy in perception around heavy traffic.
Discrepancy in planning around heavy traffic.
